title: Sussan Ley's leadership on the ropes amid Coalition divorce | ABC NEWS
description: Sussan Ley's days as Opposition Leader appear to be numbered after the National Party announced their participation in the Coaltiion was conditional on her not being leader. Professor Mark Kenny says it's all-but certain Sussan Ley will be removed as Liberal leader, but the senior member of the Coalition will be none-too-pleased that the Nationals are dictating their leadership. title: South Korea's world-first legal framework to regulate AI | ABC NEWS
description: South Korea has implemented what it claims is the world's first comprehensive set of laws regulating artificial intelligence (AI). The country aims to become one of the top three AI powerhouses globally. The new laws require tech companies to ensure human oversight, risk management, and auditing for "high-impact" AI systems. Olivia Shen, the director of the Strategic Technologies Program at the United States Studies Centre, explains that these laws are designed to support domestic AI development. This year alone, South Korea is investing 10 trillion Korean won (AUD$10 billion) in AI. In contrast, Australia's National AI plan, released late last year, ruled out any immediate comprehensive regulations, opting instead to manage AI through existing laws. title: Late diagnosis for patient as Hobart hospital faces backlog of medical scans | ABC NEWS
description: The Royal Hobart Hospital is facing a significant backlog of medical scans, with at least one patient experiencing a late diagnosis. The AMA and a union say it's a sign of a system facing a range of pressures.
